alert.note: Alert for Berkshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 1:35PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of western Massachusetts and east central New York, including the following counties, in western Massachusetts, Berkshire. In east central New York, Columbia and Rensselaer. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 135 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsfield, Great Barrington, Chatham, Claverack, Lee, Lenox, Livingston, Copake, Sheffield, Cheshire, Stephentown, New Lebanon, Austerlitz, Ancram, Philmont, Canaan, Hancock, Housatonic, Ashley Falls and Claverack-Red Mills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
